ARTICLE.TITLE: Akar meets Minister of French Armed Forces
ARTICLE.TEXT:
NNA – Caretaker Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of National Defense, Zeina Akar, on Friday welcomed visiting Minister of the French Armed Forces, Florence Parly, at the Defense Ministry in Yarzeh.

Ministers Akar and Parly laid a wreath on the memorial statue of the Lebanese army martyrs, in the presence of Army commander’s Representative, Brigadier General Hassan Al-Khatib, French Ambassador to Lebanon, Bruno Foucher, and a number of officers from the Lebanese and French sides.

During a bilateral meeting, Minister Akar welcomed Parly at the Ministry, where they discussed the overall developments in Lebanon, especially the repercussions of the Beirut port explosion and the French aid which will arrive respectively to help the Lebanese people.

The French Minister offered condolences to Minister Akar on the martyrs of the Beirut Port blast and wished speedy recovery for all the wounded and the importance of finding all those missing.

Parly stressed that France, government and people, affirm their support and solidarity with Lebanon, especially after the painful explosion that occurred at the Beirut port and in light of the Coronavirus pandemic.

=================== L.Y
